body:
Looks like the URL for intel-mpi 2019.6 is incorrect. 

Also, is there any particular reason why the 2019.5.281 version has been skipped ?

spack install intel-mpi@2019.6.154%gcc@9.2.0
==> Installing intel-mpi
==> Searching for binary cache of intel-mpi
==> No binary for intel-mpi found: installing from source
==> Fetching http://registrationcenter-download.intel.com/akdlm/irc_nas/tec/16120/l_mpi_2019.6.154.tgz
######################################################################## 100.0%
curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 404 Not Found
==> Failed to fetch file from URL: http://registrationcenter-download.intel.com/akdlm/irc_nas/tec/16120/l_mpi_2019.6.154.tgz
    URL http://registrationcenter-download.intel.com/akdlm/irc_nas/tec/16120/l_mpi_2019.6.154.tgz was not found!
==> Fetching from http://registrationcenter-download.intel.com/akdlm/irc_nas/tec/16120/l_mpi_2019.6.154.tgz failed.
==> Error: FetchError: All fetchers failed for spack-stage-intel-mpi-2019.6.154-vkmf2q2jbqucj5fupebl3cmf6o652iw4

/shared/home/mk/azure-spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:1110, in do_fetch:
       1107                raise FetchError("Will not fetch %s" %
       1108                                 self.spec.format('{name}{@version}'), ck_msg)
       1109
  >>   1110        self.stage.create()
       1111        self.stage.fetch(mirror_only)
       1112        self._fetch_time = time.time() - start_time
       1113
title: Installation issue: intel-mpi@2019.6.154%gcc@9.2.0
